title_sort: louisa van velsor whitman to walt whitman, [31 july or 7 august 1872]
title: Louisa Van Velsor Whitman to Walt Whitman, [31 July or 7 August 1872]
text: wensdayWednesday morning abt 6 my dear walti received your letter this morning and also got one on saturdaySaturday i will write the first thing about the packages for fear i shall forget it again well walt i sent them the same day you left home the man came for your trunk) edd had left word for him as he has a slate to newmans he has been here before and is said to be very carefull he took them and said he would deliver them as directed i gave him the 25 cts and told him to get the pay for the one to go to the herald office i havent seen him since but he delivered them safe i have no doubt in the leastwe have extreme hot weather here but i dontdon'tfeel it so much as i should think i dontdon't work any more than just to get something to eat we had a little shower last night but it dontdon't seem to cool the air much i had a letter from lou she speaks very encouraging of Jimmy she says he tries to be as good as he can and minds her and is a great help to her she says his little pinched face is quite fatted up and he seems pleased to be fixed up if he only is as good as he is now she says she shall be glad she worries about little georgey) she is better some of her lameness) i see an account in the sun that the shakers would take any children and keep them till they were grown if they wished to leave they could if we could only get Georgee then it would be good) walter dear if you will send me a little change as usual in the letters you need not send the money order till you come write what time you will comei must try to write to hanna as soon as i can Louisa Van Velsor Whitman to Walt Whitman, [31 July or 7 August 1872]
